https://t.co/BnkaVA9OtO
We're ready to hit the ground running day one to deliver solutions because we believe Louisiana is worth fighting for. Our future is too important to remain on the sidelines. (3/3)

People are struggling with record-high inflation, unaffordable energy costs, hurricane recovery, traffic problems, crime and much more. Our families, small businesses, seafood industry, and many other sectors of Louisiana‚Äôs economy need help. (2/3)

We filed for election for Louisiana‚Äôs 6th Congressional District seat.

We deserve a government that works with us -- not against us. There are urgent needs in our communities that have to be addressed and that's why we are running for Congress. (1/3) https://t.co/mmIRqnOstM

A $4.6 MILLION investment to help Louisiana create more jobs and make us more competitive.

The funds will provide direct investment into our different needs such as infrastructure, transportation, workforce training and education, and small business development. https://t.co/BW3ahoEOGA

Creating jobs and a stronger economy in South Louisiana begins with grants like this from the Economic Development Administration.

This grant will assist the cost of the new building and produce approximately 500 jobs. https://t.co/XVBL2JJRPW

This year, we celebrated the new radio communications tower in St. John the Baptist Parish. 

It will allow emergency response efforts to be communicated effectively, even in major storm conditions, since cellular and cable connections have struggled in the past. https://t.co/A1WEwHcqOa

Every single day, our law enforcement puts their lives at risk and this year has presented a completely new set of challenges. 

We worked to secure funding for departments so they could acquire PPE. https://t.co/jAe7ZmEAxU
This year, we worked to secure thousands of dollars in DOJ grants for South Louisiana sheriff departments to reduce crime and keep our communities safe. https://t.co/rL07Mzb2Ru

We also need to keep airports in top condition for when air travel picks back up to normal operating capacity when COVID-19 rescinds. 

More here on the secured federal funding for airports: (2/2) 

https://t.co/nnQxqy3Ujl

In TOTAL, we‚Äôve secured $140.5 MILLION for South Louisiana airports the last two years.

Investments in our airports increase the number of available flights, boost customer experience, promote a safer travel experience, and bolster the surrounding local economy. (1/2) https://t.co/IZOqgARirO

For information on other airports and funding, view here: (2/2) 
https://t.co/p97Z1Ef0BY
This year we worked to secure $159,000 for several airports in South Louisiana in response to COVID-19. (1/2) https://t.co/T2DQ1X2759

Other information below for MSY and BTR funding: (2/2)

https://t.co/ehhKfEueyg
Over the last two years, we have worked to secure nearly $1.3 MILLION in federal funding for the Louisiana Regional Airport in Gonzales. (1/2) https://t.co/eFHMtaRivH
We‚Äôre excited to continue putting out policy solutions that enhance our country‚Äôs clean energy dominance. (2/2)

I am proud to have @Citiz4Solutions support as we work to earn another term serving the people of South Louisiana: The case study for how innovation, adaptation, technology and smart policies can work together to ensure American energy and the environment both thrive. (1/2) https://t.co/TTWGG8V7dy

More here on additional federal funding for airports in South Louisiana: (2/2)
https://t.co/DskN7n430f
In the last two years, we have worked to secure over $41 MILLION in federal funding for the Baton Rouge Metropolitan Airport. (1/2) https://t.co/u8XvGpGTMg
In the last two years, we have worked to secure nearly $100 MILLION in federal funding for the New Orleans Louis Armstrong Airport. https://t.co/DVdoA5Xu20

For Denham Springs Elementary, Southside Jr. High & Southside Elementary, this brought $40.5 million of federal flood recovery to repair damages.

We took lessons learned here in South LA & found solutions so future disaster victims don‚Äôt suffer the nightmare we did. (2/2)

We led the way to change laws after the 2016 Flood to help disaster victims, schools and local businesses recover for cheaper and faster.

POTUS signed our bill into law, allowing entities to receive millions more in FEMA grants. (1/2) https://t.co/EXGMzvhi5s

More information here on the current and future projects we secured funding for: (2/2)

https://t.co/Uku1c67Xr0

A major win for South Louisiana. 

We have worked tirelessly to cut the cost in BILLIONS on the Morganza-to-the-Gulf Hurricane Protection System. 

We need to be proactive and invest BEFORE a storm, and not spend more after the fact. (1/2) https://t.co/exHdyPtUng

More information here on the current and future projects we secured funding for: (2/2)

https://t.co/Uku1c67Xr0

For decades, all we got was a giant bathtub in return for millions in taxpayer dollars.

But we changed this - we got FULL funding for the Comite Diversion Project.

This means better protection for our: 
- Homes
- Businesses
- Families 
- AND lower flood insurance 

(1/2) https://t.co/JNwyrtqQdw

More information here on the current and future projects we secured funding for: (2/2)
https://t.co/Uku1c67Xr0

We secured FULL FUNDING after it was an idle project for FOUR DECADES.

The long awaited hurricane levee was fully funded in 2018 by the federal government after Congress authorized the project for $760 million. (1/2) https://t.co/JyGnl6bkv0

Since the 2016 Flood, we have secured $3 BILLION in federal funding for flood protection projects in South Louisiana. 

AND we secured an extra $1.2 BILLION for future flood problems.

We must make these investments to better protect our homes, businesses and livelihoods. https://t.co/IpCG8zjF36
The link to the video can be found here: (2/2) https://t.co/WRG0kNe7nL

South Louisiana fuels the nation. 

We‚Äôre home to 5 of the top 15 tonnage ports in the COUNTRY.

We have to keep Louisiana as a top GLOBAL competitor to advance our state. (1/2) https://t.co/NhA57pzc3f

More information on wins we've secured to strengthen South Louisiana can be found below. (4/4)

https://t.co/OndUkGhkUj

By increasing the capacity on our waterways, this helps alleviate the traffic congestion on the road. 

These investments are a win in more ways than one and build on top of the successes we've secured. (3/4)

The major investments include:

- $13.4 million awarded to the Port of South Louisiana to bolster the port's production capacity.
- $85 million to deepen the Mississippi River by 50 feet
- $3.1 million to increase barge capacity between Baton Rouge and New Orleans 

(2/4)

Better ports and deeper access points lead to a stronger Louisiana.

We have: 

- 5 of the top 15 US ports 
- 6 of the class-one rail lines
- Proximity to the Gulf of Mexico
- Access to the MS River & other major waterways 

(1/4) https://t.co/2rnVORNhTP

More information here on infrastructure projects in South Louisiana that are the result of legislation we passed five years ago: (2/2)
https://t.co/TlRpKBdYRS

Modernizing project reviews will save time and money.

This will expedite projects in South Louisiana - whether coastal restoration & flood protection, or energy infrastructure & transportation infrastructure.

AND - it'll speed up the timeline to get a new MS River bridge. (1/2) https://t.co/zvIQQYL9Pq

Read their full statement here: (2/2)

https://t.co/rkA72qI1NK

ENDORSED by the @LAGOP!

"Rep. Graves has made tremendous progress in rebuilding Louisiana's coastline, funding flood mitigation projects, and cutting taxes for small businesses and middle-class Americans": (1/2) https://t.co/6JTBWwfnqn

The video above is from 2018, and the original link can be found here: (3/3)
https://t.co/1frMAAAtyd

https://t.co/TlRpKBdYRS

We‚Äôre fixing stupid.
 
There's a reason the Washington St. exit is the only place in the country where the interstate dropped down to one lane: because it is stupid.
 
That's why we wrote and passed federal legislation to fix it. (1/3) https://t.co/n3vZIUkMyC

This extra $14 MILLION builds on top of the $1 BILLION we secured through legislation we passed five years ago. More here: (2/2)
https://t.co/TlRpKBdYRS

Our traffic is a problem. Our infrastructure needs to be fixed.

Fortunately, we are starting to see light at the end of the tunnel and making the right investments to bolster our state. (1/2) https://t.co/6yfRBtM1jd

Louisiana has some of the worst traffic in the country.

But we have done something about it. 

We rewrote the law to fix the problems, bringing almost $1 BILLION in grant funding to Louisiana, and we are making traffic improvements a reality. https://t.co/Cq6QNlEbDk
